intro: Weinmannia piurensis, commonly known as the Piura Weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors that attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
